quoteFirst: Five hundred yards away from camp I reached the path usually taken by the game when going down to drink at the river. The grantei, as I knew from previous observation, usually came down at ten o’clock in the morning; so at a
quoteLast: I concealed myself behind the trunk of a thorn tree, stretching myself out at full length upon the ground, a most uncomfortable position, as the ground was strewn with little knobs of rock firmly embedded in the soil. When I did venture to remove some loose pieces that inconvenienced my elbows and knees, I disturbed a few colonies of tiny ants, which, although they did not bite, crawled all over me in a most uncomfortable manner.
title: An ivory trader in North Kenia
author: Arkell-Hardwick, A. (Alfred), 1878-1912

quoteFirst: The first report that he was approaching the enemy was given to Hawke by the signal of the =Maidstone= at about half-past eight. But it was not until a
quoteLast: that Howe in the =Magnanime=, who had been sent on to make the land and guide the fleet, was able to signal that the French fleet was ahead, and to report its force. Meanwhile the French admiral, who was at first incredulous of the approach of his opponent, had been convinced at last that the British fleet was indeed upon him, and had begun to collect his ships, which had been scattered in pursuit of Duff.
title: A Short History of the Royal Navy, 1217-1815. Volume II, 1689-1815

quoteFirst: There the desolation was, perhaps, even more marked than in the house. The great clock on the tower above the main building had stopped at a
quoteLast: on some long-forgotten day, and a spider now ran his web from hand to hand. At our feet, between the stones, grass grew luxuriantly, thick moss covered the coping of the well, the doors were almost off their hinges, and rats scuttled through the empty loose boxes at our approach.

quoteFirst: I loved to hear him speak enthusiastically of the Brotherhood of Man--I, who knew the brotherhood of man was to the ape, the serpent, and the tiger--and he seemed to find a pleasure in stealing a moment's chat with me from his engrossing self-appointed duties. quoteLast: on the night of December 3rd he came to me. Naturally I said nothing about this visit at the inquest or the trial.
